prompt: Annual Study Finds Rise in Beach Closures (AP) AP - The number of days that beaches closed or posted warnings because of pollution rose sharply in 2003 due to more rainfall, increased monitoring and tougher standards, an environmental group said on Thursday.
text: Annual Study Finds Rise in Beach Closures (AP) AP - The number of days that beaches closed or posted warnings because of pollution rose sharply in 2003 due to more rainfall, increased monitoring and tougher standards, an environmental group said on Thursday. More than one million beach closures were recorded between 2001 and 2003 with 90 percent of those being in coastal areas, an environmental safety report said. That is up from 69 percent for 2007. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration also says more than 90 percent of all beach closures are in less than one out of every 35 counties surveyed. Nearly one million fewer beaches were closed in 2002 and 2003.
